biopsyDate.description: the date the biopsy/sample was taken/collected

analysisRole.description: key indicating which analysis this comparator was used for

size.description: the number of samples included in the cohort/reference distribution

copyChange.description: the ploidy corrected copy change value

end.description: the genomic end position of the copy segment this gene copy number was called from

kbCategory.description: the graphkb copy variant vocabulary term this variant belongs to. By default only amplifications and deep deletions are matched

lohState.description: the loss-of-heterozygosity category for this gene region

start.description: the genomic start position of the copy segment this gene copy number was called from

size.description: size of the copy change segment in the chromosome

biopsySiteFoldChange.description: the fold change with respect to the median of the biopsy site expression comparator cohort

biopsySitePercentile.description: the percentile with respect to the biopsy site expression comparator cohort

biopsySiteZScore.description: the zscore with respect to the biopsy site expression comparator cohort

biopsySitekIQR.description: the kIQR with respect to the biopsy site expression comparator cohort

diseaseFoldChange.description: the fold change with respect to the median of the disease expression comparator cohort

diseasePercentile.description: the percentile with respect to the disease expression comparator cohort

diseaseZScore.description: the zscore with respect to the disease expression comparator cohort

diseasekIQR.description: the kIQR with respect to the disease expression comparator cohort

expressionState.description: Overloads the kb-category just for display purposes (does not affect matching)

histogramImage.description: path to the expression density/histogram plot

kbCategory.description: Determines if the expression object is considered an outlier and matched against GraphKB. If the more general terms are used it will match both RNA and protein expression variants. If the RNA specific terms are used, protein expression variants will be excluded

primarySiteFoldChange.description: the fold change with respect to the median of the primary site expression comparator cohort

primarySitePercentile.description: the percentile with respect to the primary site expression comparator cohort

primarySiteZScore.description: the zscore with respect to the primary site expression comparator cohort

primarySitekIQR.description: the kIQR with respect to the primary site expression comparator cohort

internalPancancerFoldChange.description: the fold change with respect to the median of the internal pancancer expression comparator cohort

internalPancancerPercentile.description: the percentile with respect to the internal pancancer expression comparator cohort

internalPancancerZScore.description: the zscore with respect to the internal pancancer expression comparator cohort

internalPancancerkIQR.description: the kIQR with respect to the internal pancancer expression comparator cohort

rpkm.description: reads per kilobase of transcript, per million mapped reads

pathology.description: the disease state of this sample

protocol.description: the sequencing protocol used for ths sample

key.description: image key, used by IPR to identify both the type of image and where to place it in the report

kbDiseaseMatch.description: the disease name to used in matching to GraphKB. This will be used to populate the matchedCancer flag

indelPercentile.description: Percentile of the count of indels in the current sample relative to a reference distribution

indels.description: Absolute number of indels in the current sample

indelsFrameshift.description: Absolute number of indels which result in a frameshift in the current sample

snv.description: Absolute number of single nucleotide variants in the current sample

snvPercentile.description: Percentile of the count of single nucleotide variants in the current sample relative to a reference distribution

snvTruncating.description: Absolute number of single nucleotide variants which are truncating in the current sample

sv.description: Absolute number of structural variants in the current sample

svExpressed.description: Absolute number of expressed (support in RNA) structural variants in the current sample

svPercentile.description: Percentile of the count of structural variants in the current sample relative to a reference distribution

associations.description: known behaviours, processes, or phenotypes that are associated with the current signature

kbCategory.description: The kb category will be used to create a categorical verion of the signature variant which can be matched and annotated against GraphKB

selected.description: Flag used to determine if this signature should be highlight on the main summary page of the report

correlation.description: The RNA correlation between this sample and the report sample

library.description: The library name of this sample

patientId.description: The patient ID of this sample

tumourContent.description: the tumour content or purity of this sample

biopsySite.description: description of the biopsy site location

physician.description: the treating (or enrolling) physician for the current patient

ploidy.description: The ploidy model used for calling copy variants and determining mutation affected alleles

presentationDate.description: date this case is scheduled to be presented to the molecular tumour board

project.description: The name of the project that this report will be uploaded to

chromosome.description: the chromosome this mutation is located on

endPosition.description: the genomic end poition of this variant

hgvsCds.description: HGVS coding sequence notation for this variant

hgvsGenomic.description: HGVS genomic notation for this variant

hgvsProtein.description: HGVS protein notation for this variant

ncbiBuild.description: the genome reference assembly build version

normalAltCount.description: the number of alternate reads in the normal genome supporting the mutation

normalDepth.description: the total number of reads at this position in the normal genome

normalRefCount.description: the number of reference reads in the normal genome

proteinChange.description: the HGVS protein notation. Can also be the cds or genomic notation for variants where there is no equivalent protein notation. Protein notation is preferred.

rnaAltCount.description: the number of alternate reads in the rna supporting the mutation

rnaDepth.description: the total number of reads at this position in the rna

rnaRefCount.description: the number of reference reads in the rna

startPosition.description: the genomic start position of this variant

tumourAltCopies.description: the number of gene copies in the tumour genome supporting the mutation

tumourAltCount.description: the number of alternate reads in the tumour genome supporting the mutation

tumourDepth.description: the total number of reads at this position in the tumour genome, if not given this will be inferred based on the ref and alt count sum

tumourRefCount.description: the number of reference reads in the tumour genome

tumourRefCopies.description: the number of wildtype gene copies in tumour genome

breakpoint.description: description of the breakpoints involved in this structural variant

detectedIn.description: the sample type(s) this SV was detected in

eventType.description: the type of underlying structural variant

frame.description: Optional descriptive string for in-frame vs frame-shift SV

highQuality.description: This structural variant has a high level of supporting evidence

omicSupport.description: flag to indicate this SV has supprt from both genome and transcriptome

mavis_product_id.description: mavis product id / other tool description strings

svg.description: svg image file content for this SV

svgTitle.description: The title to accompany this SV

tumourAltCount.description: the number of alternate reads in the tumour genome supporting the mutation

tumourDepth.description: the total number of reads at this position in the tumour genome

template.description: the type of report the user is uploading. This must match the name of one of the template types in the database. These are configurable via the IPR client interface but the default values in the demo database are genomic and probe

tumourContent.description: the tumour content or purity of the current sample
